faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about sending money to Vietnam

q1.q: How long does it take for money to arrive in Vietnam?
q1.a: Most transfers arrive within 1-4 hours during business hours in Vietnam. Bank transfers may take up to 24 hours depending on the receiving bank's processing time. E-wallet transfers (Momo, ZaloPay) are typically instant.

q2.q: What are the fees for sending money?
q2.a: Our standard transfer fee is $1.50 CAD. However, if you send $1,000 CAD or more, we waive the transfer fee completely! There are no hidden charges - what you see is what you pay.

q3.q: Is my money safe and secure?
q3.a: Absolutely! We use bank-level encryption and comply with Canadian financial regulations. Your personal and financial information is protected with industry-leading security measures. All transfers are tracked and guaranteed.

q4.q: What payment methods can I use?
q4.a: You can send money using Interac e-Transfer, Credit/Debit Card, or Bank Transfer. Each method is secure and processed quickly. Interac e-Transfer is typically the fastest option for Canadian customers.

q5.q: How do I track my transfer?
q5.a: After completing your transfer, you'll receive a tracking number via email. You can log into your account anytime to check the status in real-time. We'll also notify you when the money has been successfully delivered.

q6.q: What information do I need about the recipient?
q6.a: For bank transfers, you'll need the recipient's full name, bank account number, and bank name. For e-wallets (Momo/ZaloPay), you just need their registered phone number. We guide you through each step to make it easy.

q7.q: Can I cancel or modify a transfer?
q7.a: You can cancel a transfer within 30 minutes of initiating it, as long as the money hasn't been sent yet. Contact our support team immediately if you need to make changes. Once the transfer is processed, modifications are not possible, but our support team is here to help with any issues.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about sending money to Vietnam

q1.q: How long does it take for money to arrive?
q1.a: Most transfers arrive within 1-8 hours during business hours in Vietnam. Bank transfers may take up to 24 hours depending on the receiving bank's processing time. E-wallet transfers (Momo, ZaloPay) are typically instant.

q2.q: What are the fees for sending money?
q2.a: Our standard transfer fee is $1.50 CAD. However, if you send $1,000 CAD or more, we waive the transfer fee completely! There are no hidden charges - what you see is what you pay.

q3.q: Is my money safe and secure?
q3.a: Absolutely! We use bank-level encryption and comply with Canadian financial regulations. Your personal and financial information is protected with industry-leading security measures. All transfers are tracked and guaranteed.

q4.q: What payment methods can I use?

q6.q: What information do I need about the recipient?
q6.a: For bank transfers, you'll need the recipient's full name, bank account number, and bank name. For e-wallets (Momo/ZaloPay), you just need their registered phone number. We guide you through each step to make it easy.

section1.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
section1.content: By accessing and using CanViet Exchange ("the Service"), you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provision of this agreement. If you do not agree to these Terms and Conditions, please do not use our Service.

section2.title: 2. Service Description
section2.content: CanViet Exchange provides money transfer services from Canada (CAD) to Vietnam (VND). We facilitate the transfer of funds through various payment methods including debit cards, credit cards, e-transfers, and bank wire transfers.

section3.title: 3. User Eligibility
section3.intro: To use our Service, you must:
requirements: Be at least 18 years of age
Be a legal resident of Canada
Provide accurate and complete registration information
Maintain the security of your account credentials
Be legally authorized to send funds from the accounts you use

section4.title: 4. Account Registration & User Responsibilities
responsibilities: Provide accurate, complete, and up-to-date information
Maintain the security of your account login information
Notify us immediately of any unauthorized access or use
Be responsible for all activities that occur under your account
Ensure your use of the Service is lawful and complies with all applicable laws
Provide supporting documentation for your transactions when requested
Notify us of any changes to your personal information
section4.kycNote: KYC Note: According to Canadian lawsuits, we must verify your identity before you can use our Service. See section 7 below.

section5.title: 5. Fees and Exchange Rates
section5.content: Transfer fees and exchange rates will be clearly displayed before you confirm any transaction. These rates may fluctuate based on market conditions but will be locked in once you confirm your transaction. We reserve the right to adjust fees based on the chosen payment method.

section6.title: 6. Payment Methods and Processing Times
section6.content:
You are allow to proceed the payment via Interac e-Transfer, Debit/Credit Card. Processing times vary after request "Approved":
  • EFT: 5-7 business days
  • Interac e-Transfer: 8-24 hours
  • Debit/Credit Card: 2-24 hours
We are not responsible for any delays caused by payment providers or third-party banks.

section7.title: 7. Privacy and Data Protection
section7.intro: We collect and process personal information in accordance with our Privacy Policy. By using our Service, you consent to our collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information as described in our Privacy Policy.

kyc.title: Know Your Customer (KYC) Requirements
kyc.intro: As a financial service provider operating in Canada, we are required by law to implement Know Your Customer (KYC) procedures to comply with:
requirements: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act (PCMLTFA)
Financial Transactions and Reports Analysis Centre of Canada (FINTRAC) regulations

whyCollect.title: Why We Collect Your Information
whyCollect.intro: We collect your personal information and identity documents for the following purposes:
purposes: Identity Verification: To confirm you are who you claim to be and prevent identity theft or fraud
Legal Compliance: To meet regulatory requirements under Canadian federal and provincial laws
Risk Assessment: To evaluate and manage potential risks associated with money laundering, terrorist financing, or other illegal activities
Transaction Monitoring: To detect and report suspicious transactions as required by law
Service Provision: To process your transfer requests accurately and securely

howSecure.title: How We Secure Your Information
howSecure.intro: We take the security and confidentiality of your personal information seriously and implement multiple layers of protection:
measures: Encryption: All data transmitted between your device and our servers is encrypted
Secure Storage: Personal information and documents are stored in encrypted databases with restricted access
Data Minimization: We only collect information that is necessary for regulatory compliance and service provision

retention.title: Data Retention and Your Rights
retention.content: We retain your personal information for as long as required by Canadian law (typically 5-7 years after your last transaction) to comply with record-keeping obligations under FINTRAC regulations.

section8.title: 8. Prohibited Activities
section8.intro: You may not use our Service to:
activities: Send funds for illegal goods or services
Engage in money laundering or terrorist financing
Violate any laws or regulations in Canada or Vietnam
Attempt to manipulate exchange rates or fees

section9.title: 9. Cancellations and Refunds
section9.beforeProcessing: Before Processing: You may cancel a transfer before it has been processed or approved status. Contact us immediately for assistance.
section9.afterProcessing: After Processing: Once a transfer has been processed and sent to the recipient's bank, it cannot be cancelled or reversed.
section9.refunds: Refunds: Refunds are issued in the original currency (CAD) and may be subject to exchange rate differences. Processing fees are non-refundable except in cases of service error.

section10.title: 10. Liability and Disclaimers
section10.serviceAvailability: Service Availability: While we strive to provide uninterrupted service, we do not guarantee that the Service will be available at all times. We are not liable for any loss resulting from service downtime.
section10.exchangeRate: Exchange Rate Fluctuations: We are not responsible for losses due to exchange rate changes between the time you initiate and complete a transfer.
section10.thirdParty: Third-Party Services: We rely on third-party payment processors and banks. We are not liable for delays or failures caused by these third parties.
section10.maxLiability: Maximum Liability: Our total liability for any claim related to our Service is limited to the amount of the specific transaction in question.

section11.title: 11. Dispute Resolution
section11.p1: If you have a complaint or dispute regarding our Service, please contact us at services@canvietexchange.com. We will work to resolve issues within 30 business days.
section11.p2: Any disputes that cannot be resolved through negotiation shall be subject to the laws of the Province of British Columbia, Canada, and the federal laws of Canada applicable therein.

section12.title: 12. Changes to Terms
section12.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms and Conditions at any time. We will notify users of significant changes via email or through a notice on our website. Your continued use of the Service after changes constitute acceptance of the modified terms.

section13.title: 13. Termination
section13.content: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your account and access to our Service at any time, without notice, for conduct that we believe violates these Terms and Conditions or is harmful to other users, us, or third parties, or for any other reason.

section14.title: 14. Contact Information
section14.intro: If you have any questions about these Terms and Conditions, please contact us via:

section15.title: 15. Acknowledgment
section15.content: By using CanViet Exchange, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions.

help.title: How Can We Help?
help.subtitle: Fill out the form below and we'll get back to you soon
help.name: Your Name
help.messagePlaceholder: Please describe your issue in detail...
help.success: Thank you! We've received your message and will respond soon.
help.error: Failed to submit. Please try again.

q1.q: Do I need to verify my identity?
q1.a: Email verification is required for all accounts. Additional identity verification may be required for larger transfers to comply with Canadian financial regulations.

Card payments: within 24 business hours
E-Transfer: Within 24 business hours
Electronic Funds Transfers (EFT): 5-7 business days
Note: Processing time may vary based on payment method, recipient bank, and other factors.
q1.q: Why does my transfer take longer than expected?
How is your exchange rate calculated?
q1.a: In order to have an appealing rate, we utilize stablecoin-backed dollar sending encrypted currency across the world. Our exchange rate is calculated accuracy in timing and better pricing.

q2.q: Will the exchange rate change after I submit?
q2.a: The exchange rate shown at the time of confirmation is locked in for your transfer. Rates are updated constantly to reflect current market conditions.

q1.q: How do I track my transfer?
q1.a: Log in to your account and navigate to "Transfer History" in the dashboard. You'll see the status of all your transfers with details including transaction ID, amount, and delivery status. You can also share the tracking link with your recipient.

q2.q: What do the different statuses mean?
q2.a:
Pending: We've received your request and are awaiting to receive your funds
Approved: Transfer approved and funds are being sent to recipient
Completed: Recipient has received the money
Rejected: Transfer could not be processed (contact support if needed)

q1.q: My transfer is taking longer than expected. What should I do?
q1.a: Processing times can vary based on payment method, recipient bank policies, weekends, and holidays. If your transfer is significantly delayed beyond the estimated delivery time, please contact our support team with your transaction ID.

q2.q: I entered the wrong recipient information. What can I do?
q2.a: Contact support immediately if the transfer is still in "Pending" status. We may be able to correct the information or cancel the transfer. Once approved or completed, we cannot modify recipient details.

q3.a: Transfers may be rejected due to incorrect recipient information, compliance issues, insufficient verification, or payment processing failures. Check your email for specific details or contact support for assistance.
